thread.title: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez should join Inter - Medel
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez should join Inter - Medel | Daily Mail Online

author: Amitai Winehouse For Mailonline
title: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez should join Inter - Medel
text:
Alexis Sanchez should consider a move to Inter Milan, according to compatriot Gary Medel.
The Arsenal forward's future is uncertain, with his contract at the Emirates set to run out in the summer and there being little indication that he is ready to put pen to paper on fresh terms.
A series of Europe's biggest clubs have been linked with a move for Sanchez, and Sportsmail has previously understood that the Chilean will not stay at Arsenal if Arsene Wenger leaves.
Alexis Sanchez's future at Arsenal is uncertain, with his contract to expire in the summer
SANCHEZ'S STATS Appearances - 25 | Goals - 17
Shot accuracy - 59 per cent
Chances created - 63
*All stats are from the Premier League in 2016-17 only*
Inter are expected to have a huge summer in terms of investment in their squad as they look to push for a Serie A crown next season, and Medel wants Sanchez to keep the San Siro side in his thoughts as he plots his next move.
'Alexis is a player everyone knows. He's one of those strikers that all the top clubs look at,' he told Corriere dello Sport, as reported by Goal.com .
'I don't know what his future will be, but if he asks for information on Inter, I'll say that here we have a great squad, a very good coach and directors who are hungry for victories.
His Chile team-mate Gary Medel (centre) has urged him to join Inter Milan in the summer
'You won't find a project like this elsewhere.'
The Italian giants take on Roma in Serie A on Sunday afternoon as they push for a top three finish and possible qualification for the Champions League.
Fourth-placed Inter are six points behind Napoli in the Italian top flight.
Sanchez is on a short break, with Arsenal not set to play again until March 4, when they take on Liverpool at Anfield.
Medel believes Sanchez is the sort of striker that is coveted by most of the biggest sides
